info.game_comments:
2000 Tournament of Champions semifinal game 1.
From the Atlanta Civic Center.

(1, 1).clue: Thousands of these Protestants were killed by pro-Catholic forces in the Massacre of Saint Bartholomew's Day

(2, 1).clue: Bobby Jones' Grand Slam didn't include this Augusta, Georgia tournament he later co-founded

(3, 1).clue: The energy released during fission can be calculated using this famous calculation

(4, 1).clue: The head of a union of these workers calls them the only mainly female transportation work force

(5, 1).clue: 2-letter word that means "you" in Julius Caesar's dying words

(6, 1).clue: In Japan, a type of this curd normally made with soy beans is made with kudzu

(1, 2).clue: In 1709 Sweden was defeated by this Russian czar in the Battle of Poltava, losing its dominance in the Baltic area

(2, 2).clue: In 1999 Justin Leonard's putt capped the dramatic U.S. comeback to help win this trophy

(3, 2).clue: In 1938 2 Germans bombarded this element, No. 92, with neutrons, but didn't realize they'd induced a fission reaction

(4, 2).clue: By federal regulation, you have to be told that federal law bars "tampering with, disabling, or destroying" this

(5, 2).clue: "You" is defined as the pronoun of this "person", singular or plural

(6, 2).clue: Like ginseng, kudzu finds its way into medicinal & herbal varieties of this beverage

(1, 3).clue: In 1996 Emil Constantinescu defeated Ion Iliescu in a runoff election for president of this country

(2, 3).clue: Seen here, he learned his game working as a greenskeeper in Texas

(3, 3).clue: In 1942 this Italian-born physicist & his team produced the first controlled self-sustaining fission reaction

(4, 3).clue: This airline term for "to get off an aircraft" sounds like Tattoo's line on "Fantasy Island"

(5, 3).clue: A little-used plural of "thou", it comes before "of little faith"

(6, 3).clue: Kudzu leaves can be dipped in a light batter & cooked this way until crispy like a potato chip

(1, 4).clue: In 1905 journalist Arthur Griffith founded this political party, urging the Irish to not pay taxes to the British

(2, 4).clue: Now married to Ray Knight, she joined the LPGA Hall of Fame in 1987, the year she turned 30

(3, 4).clue: It was named for a district of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, first assigned because early work was done at Columbia

(4, 4).clue: The "type II" version of the fluid for this winter process is good for about 30 minutes

(5, 4).clue: This Brooklynese plural of "you" is a homophone of a word meaning "multiple female sheep"

(6, 4).clue: This purplish part of the kudzu plant can be turned into a jelly

(1, 5).clue: In 1928 this finance minister grabbed power & began his 40-year rule as dictator of Portugal

(2, 5).clue: In 2000 Tiger Woods' winning streak brought new attention to this man's record 11 straight wins in 1945

(3, 5).clue: The director of the Los Alamos lab, he owned a cabin near Santa Fe called "Perro Caliente" ("Hot Dog")

(4, 5).clue: This cable outfit's airport network is now seen at over 1,500 gate areas in the U.S.

(5, 5).clue: This Southern plural of "you" is a homophone of a word meaning "a two-masted sailing vessel"

(6, 5).clue: A powder made from this part of the plant is used as a starchy thickener for soups

(1, 1).clue: The 14th century "Black Death" that swept Europe was this type of plague, from the Greek for "groin"

(2, 1).clue: This ancient time-measuring device must be designed for its specific location on Earth

(3, 1).clue: Woody Harrelson hustled basketball games while Rosie Perez won big on "Jeopardy!" in this comedy

(5, 1).clue: In the 1930s she wrote biographies of her father & mother, who were Presbyterian missionaries to China

(6, 1).clue: Paronomasia, from the Greek for "A play on words", is the rhetorical term for this 3-letter word

(1, 2).clue: The first of these was the Nile turning to blood

(2, 2).clue: Of dog days, halcyon days or salad days, the one that's the most weather-related

(3, 2).clue: It's the "monster" hit seen here: [video clue]
(3, 2).correct response: The Creature From The Black Lagoon

(4, 2).clue: "If You Seek A Pleasant Peninsula, Look About You"

(5, 2).clue: In his 1841 essay "Self-Reliance", he wrote, "Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind"

(6, 2).clue: An example of antanaclasis is Ben Franklin's "We must all hang together, or....we shall all" do this

(1, 3).clue: This physician & seer of the "centuries" treated plague victims in 16th century France

(2, 3).clue: You don't have to check your watch, you know it's this time if you see mad dogs & Englishmen

(3, 3).clue: A terrorist group plots to blow up the Super Bowl in this 1977 flick

(5, 3).clue: His 2 middle names were Scott & Key

(2, 4).clue: Brazil is celebrating its qunicentennial, this many years since its discovery by the Portuguese

(3, 4).clue: Jennifer Jason Leigh played the roommate from hell in this 1992 thriller

(5, 4).clue: From 1944 to 1946 he served as a naval historian in the south Pacific

(6, 4).clue: Character who gave his name to lines like, " 'The prisoner's coming down,' he said condescendingly"

(1, 5).clue: In his diary, Samuel Pepys recounted the "Great Plague" sweeping through London in this decade

(2, 5).clue: From the Latin for "grape-gathering", it's the time for gathering grapes for wine

(3, 5).clue: Cops Michael Douglas & Andy Garcia tangle with the Japanese mafia in this 1989 film

(5, 5).clue: This author & his loose lifestyle were the subject of Tom Wolfe's "The Electric Kool-Aid Acid Test"

(6, 5).clue: A contronym can mean 2 opposite things, like this word meaning "to adhere" & "to divide"

(0, 0).clue: Known to many as The Colossus, this man was elected to the Cape Colony Assembly in 1881
